Article.Abstract: MHC class I-restricted T cell responses to viral proteins focus on a limited set of peptides. To better understand this phenomenon, we examined all of the 26 nonameric peptides encoded by the influenza virus A/Puerto Rico/8/34 (PR8) conforming to the canonical Kd binding motif. Ten peptides bound strongly to Kd as assessed by a cell surface stabilization assay. Five of these 10 induced in vitro secondary CD8+ T cell responses from splenocytes derived from PR8-immunized mice. The strongest responses were induced by the two previously defined antigenic peptides, which ranked only second and fifth in relative binding affinity. To examine the limiting factors in the immunogenicity of Kd-binding peptides, we produced recombinant vaccinia viruses (rVVs) expressing cytosolic or endoplasmic reticulum (ER)-targeted peptides. rVVs expressing ER-targeted versions of the 7 peptides with the highest relative affinities for Kd rescued Kd cell surface expression in T2 cells, while those expressing the 3 lowest affinity peptides did not. The immunogenicity of several, but not all, of the highest affinity peptides was greatly enhanced when expressed as VV-encoded cytosolic or ER-targeted peptides as compared with full length proteins. We conclude that limitations in the immunogenicity of class I binding peptides reflects, in order of decreasing importance, peptide liberation by cellular proteases, T cell repertoire, and TAP-mediated peptide transport. We also observed an additional important contributing factor: suppression of T cell responses to nondominant peptides by an immunodominant peptide located in the same protein.
Article.ArticleTitle: MHC affinity, peptide liberation, T cell repertoire, and immunodominance all contribute to the paucity of MHC class I-restricted peptides recognized by antiviral CTL.
Article.Affiliations: Laboratory of Viral Diseases, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, Bethesda, MD 20892, USA.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Animals; Antigen Presentation; CD8-Positive T-Lymphocytes(metabolism); Cytotoxicity, Immunologic; H-2 Antigens(metabolism); Immunodominant Epitopes(metabolism; physiology); Influenza A virus(immunology; metabolism); Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Peptide Fragments(chemical synthesis; immunology; metabolism); Protein Binding(immunology); T-Lymphocyte Subsets(metabolism)

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide-pulsed or virus-infected autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide or with the virus, implying processing of this epitope from the virus is impaired. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide, but to a lower degree than previously described antigenic determinants that were shown to have a lower affinity for MHC Kd molecules, showing that MHC affinity is important but not the sole criterion for antigenicity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector, either with or without a ER targeting sequence) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, to a higher degree than when the splenocytes were restimulated with (and/or the assay was performed against) the virus, implying processing of this epitope from the virus is impaired. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

This peptide ranks first in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 0-0.2 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells both as a peptide and when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene, either targeted to the ER by a signal peptide or not.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide, but to a lower degree than a previously described antigenic determinant which was shown to have a similar affinity for MHC Kd molecules, showing that MHC affinity is important but not the sole criterion for antigenicity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector, either with or without a ER targeting sequence) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, to a higher degree than when mice were infected with (or the splenocytes restimulated, or the assay was performed against) source species, implying processing of this epitope from the virus is impaired. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus infected autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with virus implying processing of this epitope from the virus is impaired (but not its immunogenicity, since epitope specific responses are achieved by epitope immunization and in vitro restimulation). The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

This peptide ranks 4th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 20-200 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells both as a peptide and when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene, either targeted to the ER by a signal peptide or not.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Previously known antigenic peptide in the response against Influenza A PR8.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide, but to a higher degree than other determinants which were shown to have a similar or higher affinity for MHC Kd molecules, showing that MHC affinity is important but not the sole criterion for antigenicity.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide-pulsed or virus-infected autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro either with virus or the epitopic peptide, implying efficient processing of this epitope from the whole virus. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, to a similar degree than when splenocytes were restimulated with (or the assay was performed against) source species, implying efficient processing of this epitope from the whole virus. Besides, the responses against 2 other nucleoprotein epitopes (NP218-226 and NP 39-47) in those mice, after in vitro stimulation of splenocytes with that epitopes, is impaired by the previous priming with this epitope. This result is controlled using a mutant version of this epitope known not to bond MHC Kd molecules, which is then unable to affect the response to the other epitopes. Those results imply the presence of responses against this immunodominant epitope are able to suppress the responses towards the two immunoreccesive epitopes. This effect is not mediated by direct antagonistic effects of this epitope on the TCRs specific for the other 2 epitopes. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

This peptide ranks 5th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 20-200 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8, while it is one of the 2 known antigenic and immunodominant epitopes. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells both as a peptide and when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene, either targeted to the ER by a signal peptide or not.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector, either with or without a ER targeting sequence) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, implying this epitope is antigenic and immunogenic per se. The negative results with virus infected mice, or with epitope infected mice against virus infected cells show that, nevertheless, the processing of this epitope from the virus is impaired. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are not lysed by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide. This lack of antigenicity in this situation is consistent with an impaired presentation in vivo from whole virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus-infected autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with either the epitope or the virus, implying processing of this epitope from the virus is impaired (but not its immunogenicity, since epitope specific responses are achieved by epitope immunization and in vitro restimulation). The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

This peptide ranks 6th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 200-2000 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells both as a peptide and when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene, either targeted to the ER by a signal peptide or not.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus-infected or peptide-pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are lysed, but weakly, by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with either the epitope or the virus. Similar result are seen against peptide pulsed cells, implying T cell recognition, and not processing, is the limiting factor. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficiently by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide. Similar results are seen in epitope-immunized mice, suggesting - since its bound by MHC with high affinity - TCR recognition of this epitope, but not its processing/presentation, as the limiting factor.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed, but weakly, by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, implying this epitope is not antigenic nor immunogenic, even when it binds Kd MHC molecules efficiently. Poor T cell recognition is suggested as the limiting factor in the response. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

This peptide ranks 3th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 2-20 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells both as a peptide and when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene, either targeted to the ER by a signal peptide or not.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Previously known antigenic peptide in the response against Influenza A PR8.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed efficiently by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide.

This peptide ranks 2nd in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 2-20 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells both as a peptide and when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene targeted to the ER by a signal peptide.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, implying this epitope is not antigenic notr immunogenic. MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus-infected or peptide-pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with the epitope. Similar result are seen against peptide pulsed cells, implying MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficiently by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide. Similar results are seen in epitope-immunized mice, suggesting MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors.

This peptide ranks 9th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 200-2000 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8, measured as MHC stabilization on T2 cells in the rpesence of peptide. Nevertheless, it fails to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene targeted to the ER by a signal peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: A.k.a. RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus-infected or peptide-pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with the epitope. Similar result are seen against peptide pulsed cells, implying MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficiently by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide. Similar results are seen in epitope-immunized mice, suggesting MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, implying this epitope is not antigenic notr immunogenic. MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

This peptide ranks 10th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 2000-20000 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8 measured as MHC stabilization on T2 cells in the rpesence of peptide. Nevertheless, it fails to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene targeted to the ER by a signal peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: A.k.a. RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P2.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with this peptide, implying this epitope is not antigenic notr immunogenic. TCR recognition is the suggested limiting factor, since MHC affinity is high enough to induce presentation on epitope transfected cells. The quantitative response given is for an E:T ratio of 60:1.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus-infected or peptide-pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with the epitope. AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficiently by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide. Similar results are seen in epitope-immunized mice, suggesting TCR recognition is the limiting factors, since MHC affinity is high enough to induce presentation on epitope transfected cells.

This peptide ranks 7th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 200-2000 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8. It is shown to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells when cells are puse with peptide or transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene targeted to the ER by a signal peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: A.k.a. RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P2.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with virus-infected or peptide-pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Virus infected target cells are not lysed efficiently by splenocytes from epitope immunized mice (as a minigene in a vaccinia virus vector) and stimulated in vitro with the epitope. AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are lysed inefficiently by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide. Similar results are seen in epitope-immunized mice, suggesting MHC affinity or TCR recognition are the limiting factors.

This peptide ranks 8th in its affinity for Kd MHC molecules (with an IC50 of 200-2000 ng/ml) among the peptides containing Kd-binding motifs from Influenza A PR8 measured as MHC stabilization on T2 cells in the rpesence of peptide. Nevertheless, it fails to stabilize MHC molecules on Kd-transfected T2 cells when cells are transfected with recombinant vaccinia encoding the epitope minigene targeted to the ER by a signal peptide.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3 weeks after immunization, splenocytes were harvested and restimulated in vitro. Splenocytes were incubated with peptide pulsed autologous/isogeneic splenocytes for 7 days.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -T cell subset identification

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Peptide pulsed target cells are not lysed to levels above background by PR8 immune splenocytes stimulated in vitro with this peptide.
This peptide, selected as containing the Kd binding motif from the complete aminoacid sequence of Influenza A PR8 proteins, is shown experimentally on Kd-expressing T2 cells to be a weak binder.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: A.k.a. RNA-directed RNA polymerase subunit P3.
